svg.font-family: 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', 'STIX Two Math', 'Latin Modern Math', 'Cambria Math', serif
svg.title: Coulomb's Law
svg.desc: The vector text decoration is a problem. An overbar can be used to get F̄ but F⃑ or F⃗ would be better. Most fonts do not have the latter two, and even if they do, the metrics may not work. Liberation Sans has them, but they mostly overlap the character and become almost invisible. Math typesetting conventions vary by country. Bold Roman (bold says vector). Bold Italic (bold says vector, and italic says variable). Regular Italic with decoration (hat or arrow to distinguish vector variable from ordinary variable). There may be Bold Roman/Italic with hat to show unit vector, but bold with arrow decoration seems uncommon.
